sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
Loves master-piece, or, The coy lady over-come at last she seemed coy as other ladies use, who (that they like best) sometimes will refuse, but in conclusion, take them in the neck of time there's few that will refuse a P---eticoat, to the tune of, With a ha, ha, ha, you will undo me, &c.
1 sheet ([2] p.) : ill. (woodcuts)
Printed for F. Coles, T. Vere and J. Wright, [London] : [1663-1674]
Caption title. Imprint from colophon. Place and date range of publication suggested by Wing (2nd ed.). Right half sheet contains: The second part to the same tune. Reproduction of original in: Bodleian Library.
=======
Loves master-piece, or, The coy lady over-come at last she seemed coy as other ladies use, who (that they like best) sometimes will refuse, but in conclusion, take them in the neck of time there's few that will refuse a P---eticoat, to the tune of, With a ha, ha, ha, you will undo me, &c.
1 sheet ([2] p.) : ill. (woodcuts)
Printed for F. Coles, T. Vere and J. Wright, [London] : [1663-1674]
Caption title. Imprint from colophon. Place and date range of publication suggested by Wing (2nd ed.). Right half sheet contains: The second part to the same tune. Reproduction of original in: Bodleian Library.
F. Coles
J. Wright
T. Vere
